name: MIT License
description: A short, permissive software license. It allows reuse within proprietary software provided all copies of the licensed software include a copy of the MIT License terms and the copyright notice.
recommended_use_cases: Projects where maximum reuse is desired

name: Apache License 2.0
description: A permissive license from the Apache Software Foundation. It allows users to freely use, modify, and distribute the software.

name: GNU General Public License v3.0
description: A strong copyleft license that ensures software and its derivatives remain free and open. Any redistribution of the software, even if modified, must be under the same license.
recommended_use_cases: Projects where keeping derivatives open source is critical

name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0
description: A weaker copyleft license for libraries. It allows linking with proprietary software but requires modifications to the library itself to be open source.
recommended_use_cases: Software libraries intended for use in both open and closed-source applications

name: BSD 3-Clause 'New' or 'Revised' License
description: A permissive free software license. It permits unrestricted redistribution for any purpose as long as its copyright notice and license's disclaimers of warranty are maintained.
recommended_use_cases: Software that may be incorporated into proprietary systems

name: Mozilla Public License 2.0
description: A weak copyleft license. It requires modifications to licensed files to be open source, but allows linking with proprietary files.
recommended_use_cases: Projects that want a balance between permissiveness and protecting contributions

name: CC BY 4.0
description: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International. This license allows others to distribute, remix, adapt, and build upon your work, even commercially, as long as they credit you for the original creation.
recommended_use_cases: Any creative work where attribution is the only requirement for reuse, including commercial use.

name: CC BY-SA 4.0
description: Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International. This license allows others to remix, adapt, and build upon your work, even commercially, as long as they credit you and license their new creations under the identical terms.
recommended_use_cases: Any creative work where you want derivatives to remain openly licensed.

name: CC BY-NC 4.0
description: Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International. This license allows others to remix, adapt, and build upon your work non-commercially, and although their new works must also acknowledge you and be non-commercial, they don’t have to license their derivative works on the same terms.
recommended_use_cases: Educational content where commercial reuse is not desired.

name: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0
description: Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International. This license allows others to remix, adapt, and build upon your work non-commercially, as long as they credit you and license their new creations under the identical terms.
recommended_use_cases: Community-driven projects where commercial use is restricted.

name: CC BY-ND 4.0
description: Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivatives 4.0 International. This license allows for redistribution, commercial and non-commercial, as long as it is passed along unchanged and in whole, with credit to you.
recommended_use_cases: Content where exact integrity is important, even with commercial reuse.

name: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0
description: Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives 4.0 International. The most restrictive of the six main licenses, allowing others to download your works and share them with others as long as they credit you, but they can’t change them in any way or use them commercially.
recommended_use_cases: Very specific and controlled distribution of original works, e.g., proprietary content with free sharing.

name: Open Font License 1.1
description: A free, libre and open source license for fonts. It permits fonts to be used, studied, modified and redistributed freely as long as they are not sold by themselves.
recommended_use_cases: Fonts intended for wide distribution and modification by designers and developers.

name: Public Domain Mark 1.0
description: A label for works that are free of known copyright restrictions and are therefore in the public domain. Not a license, but a declaration.
recommended_use_cases: Works that are definitively in the public domain and can be used freely by anyone for any purpose.

name: The Unlicense
description: A license that offers a public domain equivalent for software. It allows anyone to use the software for any purpose, without any conditions.
recommended_use_cases: Projects intended for the public domain where legal certainty is desired
